name: patterns vary
description:
This is 'patterns vary', a new video game from Outhouse Media.
Recruited from a virtual reality course in the Heartland, this exhibition takes viewers on a epic tour of the Ohio reclamation project that transformed the current industrial landscape of central Ohio. Pioneering thinkers and artists were sent on a short tour of the site to see how a simple building "could be erected" using nothing but wood, concrete, and even a little ingenuity. The first thing you see when you enter is Publix alone - a "point and shoot" store that is: an armored animal with an 8-foot barbed wire fence overturned cars a superconducting magnet a lab with polarizing lights inside that a chainsaw can be suspended from a wooden spade a hobo camp Related: John Carpenter's giant video game Animal Crossing: New Leaf is a huge success We had a chance to go to Animal Crossing: New Leaf, a game born from Fear & Loathing in Las Vegas, and it's quite pretty. Most of the game uses a camera to push people from a simple armchair so that they can play, even if it's trying to be funny. It's a huge success, even if no one really knows why.
